intro: Melandrium xainzaense, commonly known as the Yunnan catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has linear, grass-like leaves. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
